This notebook is **only used for development**.

This code plots out distributions of the coefficient of variation from
various activity-parameters within the Consolidated Human Activity
Database (CHAD).

import

.. code:: ipython3

    import sys
    sys.path.append('..//run_chad')
    sys.path.append('..//processing')
    sys.path.append('..//source')
    
    # plotting capability
    import matplotlib.pylab as plt
    
    # math capability
    import numpy as np
    
    # dataframe capability
    import pandas as pd
    
    # zipfile capability
    import zipfile
    
    # ABMHAP modules
    import my_globals as mg
    import chad_demography as cd
    import chad_demography_adult_non_work as cdanw
    import chad_demography_adult_work as cdaw
    import chad_demography_child_school as cdcs
    import chad_demography_child_young as cdcy
    import demography as dmg
    
    import activity, chad
    
    %matplotlib notebook

function

.. code:: ipython3

    def load_data(the_demographic, act, data_code):
    
        chooser = { dmg.ADULT_WORK: (cdaw.CHAD_demography_adult_work(), chad.FNAME_ADULT_WORK), 
              dmg.ADULT_NON_WORK: (cdanw.CHAD_demography_adult_non_work(), chad.FNAME_ADULT_NON_WORK), 
              dmg.CHILD_SCHOOL: (cdcs.CHAD_demography_child_school(), chad.FNAME_CHILD_SCHOOL),
              dmg.CHILD_YOUNG: (cdcy.CHAD_demography_child_young(), chad.FNAME_CHILD_YOUNG), }
        
        x, fname_zip = chooser[demo]
            
        z = zipfile.ZipFile(fname_zip)
        
        fname = x.fname_stats[act][data_code]
        
        df = pd.read_csv( z.open(fname) )
        
        return df, x
    

run

.. code:: ipython3

    demo = dmg.ADULT_WORK
    act = mg.KEY_SLEEP
    code = cd.DT
    
    raw_start, d = load_data(demo, act, cd.START)
    raw_end, d = load_data(demo, act, cd.END)
    raw_dt, d = load_data(demo, act, cd.DT)

.. code:: ipython3

    # load parameters
    s = d.int_2_param[act]
    
    print( s.toString() )
    
    # load start data
    data = raw_start.mu.values
    data = mg.to_periodic(data)
    
    # find people with "good" start time data
    idx_start = (data >= s.start_mean_min) & (data <= s.start_mean_max)
    
    # load end data
    data = raw_end.mu.values
    
    # find people with "good" end time data
    idx_end = (data >= s.end_mean_min) & (data <= s.end_mean_max)
    
    # load duration data
    data = raw_dt.mu.values
    
    # find people with "good" duration data
    idx_dt = (data >= s.dt_mean_min) & (data <= s.dt_mean_max)
    
    # find the people with "good" data
    idx = idx_start & idx_end & idx_dt
    
    # load data from people with "good" start time, end time, AND duration data
    df_start = raw_start[idx]
    df_end = raw_end[idx]
    df_dt = raw_dt[idx]


.. parsed-literal::

    start mean min: -3.000, start mean max: 3.000, start std max: 1.000
    end mean min: 5.000, end mean max: 10.000, end std max: 1.000
    dt mean min: 4.000, dt mean max: 13.000, dt std max: 1.000
    
    

plotting

.. code:: ipython3

    plt.figure(0)
    plt.hist(df_dt.cv.values)
    
    plt.title( activity.INT_2_STR[act])
    plt.xlabel('cv')
    plt.ylabel('count')
    plt.show()

.. code:: ipython3

    # std_start = mu_cv / np.sqrt(2) * mu_dt
    std = mg.hours_to_minutes( df_dt.cv.mean() / np.sqrt(2) * df_dt.mu.values )

.. code:: ipython3

    plt.figure(1)
    plt.hist(std)
    
    plt.title( activity.INT_2_STR[act])
    plt.xlabel('standard deviation')
    plt.ylabel('count')
    plt.show()



.. parsed-literal::

    <IPython.core.display.Javascript object>



.. raw:: html

    <img src="data:image/png;base64," width="640">


.. code:: ipython3

    alpha = 0.01 / np.sqrt(2)

.. code:: ipython3

    x = alpha * df_dt.mu.values
    x =  mg.hours_to_minutes(x)

.. code:: ipython3

    plt.figure(3)
    plt.hist(x)
    plt.title( activity.INT_2_STR[act])
    plt.xlabel('minutes')
    plt.show()



.. parsed-literal::

    <IPython.core.display.Javascript object>

.. code:: ipython3

    df_dt.mu.mean(), df_dt.mu.std()




.. parsed-literal::

    (7.5057573504107111, 0.95612788510172086)

    x = alpha * df_dt.mu.values
    x = mg.hours_to_minutes(x)
    
    plt.figure(4)
    plt.hist(x)
    plt.show()
